cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 225 mi E of Caibarién, Cuba and 380 mi SE of Miami, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to turn WNW, then NW)

cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest today, then turning northwest Saturday and tracking up the Florida peninsula before curving inland toward southern Georgia / the Carolinas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane watch north of Jupiter Inlet FL to Flagler/Volusia County line (does not yet include GA)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach and the Keys; tropical-storm warnings along portions of Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and South Carolina is in the potential impact envelope
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are probable; a 1 in 5 chance of sustained 50-kt (58-mph) winds with higher gusts if the track shifts east.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–6 ft inundation along the Georgia coast including the Savannah River entrance if Irma remains strong and onshore flow persists.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated 16 inches possible across coastal Georgia, capable of producing flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents ahead of the storm; possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands.
